definition: to have a stroll
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu

sentences.english: Come out for a walk instead of moping around in the house.
sentences.chinese: 別在房裏垂頭喪氣地打轉，出來散散步吧。

sentences.english: Go outside and take a walk. Maybe do some push-ups.
sentences.chinese: 出去散散步，或者做幾個俯臥撐。

sentences.english: Lets take a walk in the snow.
I go for a waddle and do stretches and exercises every day.
sentences.chinese: 我每天都會出去散散步，做做伸展運動。

sentences.english: It's not so cold today, let's take a walk in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 今天不太冷，咱們去踏雪散散步吧。

sentences.english: He's gone for ice-creams and a stroll. He doesn't like the beach.
sentences.chinese: 他去買雪糕順便散散步，他並不喜歡呆在海灘。

sentences.english: Try going for a relaxing after-dinner walk together and talk about what's on your mind.
sentences.chinese: 試着飯後一起輕鬆地散散步，跟他說說你的想法。

sentences.english: Please accompany me on my walk.
sentences.chinese: 請和我就伴一起散散步。

sentences.english: After lunch, take a long walk through Da An Park.
sentences.chinese: 午餐後，你可以在大安森林公園裏散散步。

sentences.english: When the sun comes down, it is so nice to take a walk and breathe.
sentences.chinese: 每當夕陽西下，散散步，呼吸一下是如此的美好。

sentences.english: A walk in the woods always livens me up in no time.
sentences.chinese: 在森林中散散步行總是會讓我開心起來。

sentences.english: Why do not you go for a walk ? It will give you an appetite for your lunch.
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼不出去散散步？散散步午飯時就有食慾了。

sentences.english: Why do not you go for a walk ? It will give you an appetite for your lunch.
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼不出去散散步？散散步午飯時就有食慾了。

sentences.english: Sue, let's meet this evening and go for a walk around Houhia Lake.
sentences.chinese: 蘇，咱們今晚見面，然後繞後海散散步。

sentences.english: If you’re indoors, go outdoors. Or head to the park.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是在室內，那去戶外呆會兒，或去公園散散步。

definition: to take a walk/to go for a walk
to roam around/to have a stroll
to stroll/to go for a walk
(dialect) to take a walk/to go for a stroll
to drive away cares/to relieve boredom
variant of 軋馬路|轧马路[ya4 ma3 lu4]
to be in the sun (getting warm or sunbathing etc)/to put sth in the sun (e.g. to dry it)
to take a dog for a walk
to stroll
erhua variant of 遛彎|遛弯[liu4 wan1]
to walk a dog
morning exercise
to wander/to ramble/recreational hiking/to perambulate
to wander aimlessly
to have time (to do sth)
to go for an outing/to go on an excursion
